page.title: 05ST.GILES & ALL SAINTS CHURCH
page.content: Is a flint and stone building of Norman origin,and was completed in 1300.It consists of Chancel with North and South Chapels,a nave with North aisle of five bays,South transept,South Porch and a North West tower containing five bells. The first Rector of the Church was John De Munden(1307).There have been 48 Rectors with the present one being Hugh Vaughan Crossley.The oldest relic in the Church is a christening font which dates back to the Saxon times. On July 9th 1926 a fire partially destroyed the roof of the Church. Inside the Church are photographs to show the extent of the damage. Youngsters from the village cleaned the Churchyard up in response to an appeal by the Church Warden asking them to show more interest in the community.
